page.title: 20RELIGION BRIMSCOMBE STROUD
page.content: Brimscombe Church was completed in 1839.It was paid for by the RICARDO FAMILY of Gatcombe Park Minchinhampton,now the home of HRH Princess Anne.It is unusual because the chancel and altar are at the west end.The design is a copy of Norman architecture. The clock first struck midnight on 1st January 1900.The church roof was struck by lightning in 1952 and caught fire causing much damage.The church needs to be able to serve people today and to be attractive so younger people will feel welcome.A kitchen has been built so that people can stay after services for coffee and a chat. The vicar is REV.DAVID GREEN.M.A. There is a METHODIST CHAPEL in Brimscombe which is much older.At one time services were held in a woollen mill.
